div.b: School Office Hours: Weekdays 8:00 am to 2:00 pm

td.p: On Thursday, April 16, Governor Evers extended the “Safer at Home” order until May 26. In the order, he also closed school buildings for the remainder of the school year. While the Governor closed school buildings, he did not cancel school for the remainder of the year.

During the remainder of the school year, we will continue to stay connected with our students and families through the new learning format we have put in place. We will continue to provide learning opportunities for our students virtually and through instructional packets. We know there are challenges to this format of learning, but we are dedicated to caring for and supporting our students academically, socially, and emotionally.
Meal distribution will continue on Mondays and Thursdays. If you have not signed up but would like to participate in this service, please contact the school office at 608-687-4391.

We know this is difficult for everyone. We miss our students, and we miss the traditional learning format that connects us in person with our students and families. We appreciate your understanding, patience, and flexibility as we continue providing instruction during these unprecedented times. Please watch for more information as we make plans for the remainder of the school year, graduation, summer learning, and back-to-school in the fall.
Please continue to stay safe, practice social distancing, and remain at home as much as possible.

Thank you for your patience and cooperation during our first home delivery of instructional materials this week. We appreciate the feedback that many of you have provided. Please continue to let us know if your address has changed or if you need more physical materials due to internet accessibility concerns.

Our District is now serving approximately 300 students with breakfast and lunch through our twice-weekly, home delivery system. Again, if you have not been receiving this service and would like to be added to the list, please contact the school office at 608-687-4391.

The school building has been thoroughly cleaned to prepare for the eventual return of students this school year should this be permitted. We are also making plans for the potential that we may not return to school this year as well. As we have more information, we will keep you informed and updated.

You may have noticed that we are working closely with the county and other governmental agencies to coordinate information and resource sharing. Please see the announcement below for another example of this cooperation that is being provided by the Town of Milton:

span.span: The Town of Milton and Cochrane Co-Op Telephone have partnered up to provide an emergency FREE PUBLIC WI-FI Hotspot in the parking lot of the Town of Milton Town Hall, located at S2794 State Rd 88 in Fountain City. Persons wishing to access the wi-fi should use Town of Milton Guest to log on. There should be coverage throughout the parking lot, but reception will be better closer to the building.
Please spread the word to others, particularly students who require wi-fi access to be able to download or access assignments and participate in distance learning opportunities.
PLEASE REMAIN IN YOUR VEHICLE TO ACCESS THE WI-FI.
Thank you, once again, to CCT for stepping up in a time of need!
